Body: Description: Hello, we are in a situation where we have to take over the management of a new domain and when this happens we are obliged to position the users with the right roles on the domain one by one. Is there a quicker method for setting up a number of users with a role on one or more domains at the same time?

Description Updated: We need to take over the management of a new domain, which requires assigning the correct roles to users individually. Is there a more efficient method to assign roles to multiple users across one or more domains simultaneously?

Steps to Reproduce Updated: Take over the management of a new Active Directory domain.
Identify the users who need to be assigned specific roles within the domain.
Manually assign roles to each user one by one within the domain management interface.
Repeat the manual assignment process for each user across one or more domains.

What We've Learned Updated: //Recommended solution: Use claims-based authentication.
Create a group (either in Active Directory for Windows Authentication or in the identity provider for SAML/OpenID Connect).
Add users to the group and grant them access through the console.
//API Usage:
If using the API, users need to be created first.
Retrieve all domains the users need access to.
Grant authorization for those domains via the API (though this approach may be inefficient).
Ensure permissions are set on the entity level and assign domains to the entity if not already done.
Next Steps Updated: provided instructions, awaiting reply.

Description Updated: Managing a new domain requires assigning roles to users individually. Is there a more efficient method to assign roles to multiple users across one or more domains simultaneously?
